body_html:
@zheng-xq, this is the test that I ran. My interpretation is that the issue is caused by TensorFlow:

  1. run vectorAdd -- OK
  2. sleep/wake up
  3. run vectorAdd -- OK
  4. sleep/wake up
  5. run vectorAdd -- OK
  6. run python and in there import tensorflow as tf
  7. run vectorAdd -- OK
  8. sleep/wake up
  9. run vectorAdd -- OK
  10. in the previously open python session: tf.test.gpu_device_name() -- OK
  11. run vectorAdd -- OK
  12. sleep/wake up
  13. run vectorAdd -- FAILED
  14. in the previously open python session: tf.test.gpu_device_name() -- FAILED
  15. run vectorAdd -- FAILED

Command output details

Successful vectorAdd

$ ./vectorAdd 
[Vector addition of 50000 elements]
Copy input data from the host memory to the CUDA device
CUDA kernel launch with 196 blocks of 256 threads
Copy output data from the CUDA device to the host memory
Test PASSED
Done

@zheng-xq, this is the test that I ran. My interpretation is that the issue is caused by TensorFlow:

run vectorAdd -- OK
sleep/wake up
run vectorAdd -- OK
sleep/wake up
run vectorAdd -- OK
run python and in there import tensorflow as tf
run vectorAdd -- OK
sleep/wake up
run vectorAdd -- OK
in the previously open python session: tf.test.gpu_device_name() -- OK
run vectorAdd -- OK
sleep/wake up
run vectorAdd -- FAILED
in the previously open python session: tf.test.gpu_device_name() -- FAILED
run vectorAdd -- FAILED

body:
@zheng-xq, this is the test that I ran. My interpretation is that the issue is caused by TensorFlow:

1. run vectorAdd -- OK
2. sleep/wake up
3. run vectorAdd -- OK
4. sleep/wake up
5. run vectorAdd -- OK
6. run python and in there `import tensorflow as tf`
7. run vectorAdd -- OK
8. sleep/wake up
9. run vectorAdd -- OK
10. in the previously open python session: `tf.test.gpu_device_name()` -- OK
11. run vectorAdd -- OK
12. sleep/wake up
13. run vectorAdd -- **FAILED**
14. in the previously open python session: `tf.test.gpu_device_name()` -- **FAILED**
15. run vectorAdd -- **FAILED**

## Command output details

### Successful vectorAdd

```
$ ./vectorAdd 
[Vector addition of 50000 elements]
Copy input data from the host memory to the CUDA device
CUDA kernel launch with 196 blocks of 256 threads
Copy output data from the CUDA device to the host memory
Test PASSED
Done
```

### TensorFlow import

```
>>> import tensorflow as tf
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:135] successfully opened CUDA library libcublas.so.8.0 locally
I tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc:135] successfully opened CUDA library libcudnn.so.5 locally
```
